SUBJECT: All the major subdisciplines of chemistry
CONTENT: Traditionally: organic, inorganic, physical and analytical chemistry and biochemistry (some institutions put biochemistry in the biology department; some don't consider analytical chemistry a separate subdiscipline). But that division isn't very adequate today - there are also many different categorizations or "interdisciplinary" subdisciplines which each span over many or all traditional subdisciplines, such as theoretical chemistry, computational chemistry, materials chemistry, supramolecular chemistry, colloid chemistry, nanochemistry, chemical biology (which is actually more chemistry than biochemistry is), structural chemistry...
